title: Dunder Mifflin Infinity
description: Michael feels threatened when Ryan returns to the Scranton office to share his ideas about the future of Dunder Mifflin. Jim and Pam's relationship is shared with the entire office, while Angela and Dwight's relationship is on the rocks.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I gotcha one. [Pam hands over a grape soda to Jim]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh wow, thank you.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'm just gonna grab some chips, you want some?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No. Thanks... uh we're still having lunch today, right?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I guess. [Pam smiles and walks away, then comes back and kisses Jim on the cheek] How dare you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey Toby. What's this? [holds up memo Toby has passed out to the staff]

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Ohh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [reads memo] I just want to remind everyone about the company rules involving PDA or public displays of affection.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Yes, uh some people in the office have complained...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh really.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: ...about some other people engaging in PDA and, you know [Michael leans in closer to Toby] I just wanted to remind it's not appropriate to, to do that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Is this about me and Jan? In my office? Because I will have you know that that was consensual. What we did has nothing to do with you or anyone here. I don't think. I don't think anyone heard anything. We were very discreet and, and most people had left by that point. So I don't think it's any of your business. What I think you should do is roll up the memo, real tight...

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Ok, look the memo is not about you...

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [to everyone in the room] For the record, I have never been involved with anyone at work, in any capacity.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Alright everyone, look, it, alright my complaint was about Jim and Pam. So...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [turns to address Jim and Pam] No way.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: You guys are together?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ummm... yup. Yes, we are.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Woooah! Wow!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Tuna!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Awesome!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I knew it!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You guys! Yes! Yes!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Toby, was this your fun little way of congratulating us?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh kay, mind is exploding. Get over here. [gestures to Pam to get up] Come on. Come here. Okay, okay, [to Jim] stand up. [Jim moves over in chair] OK, here we go. [holding both Pam and Jim's hand] Everyone, this is a day that will live in infamy. Because today, is the day that Jim and Pam become one.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Actually, we've been dating for a couple months.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I love you guys, so much. [hugs Jim]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ohh.. [Michael goes to hug Pam, phone rings]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Phone's ringing. [goes back toward desk]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no, no Pam let 'em ring. Let the bells of Dunder Mifflin chime out your love. Because this is [starts to well up] really good, this is really good. My heart soars with the eagles nest.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I don't see it. I think they both could do better.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: It's not a surprise to me. Pam is the office mattress.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Jim Halpert's off the market. Guess who just became the best looking single guy in the office?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey. Can you make that straighter? That's what she said.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Did you plan it?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No. [tries to hide piece of paper, but Pam grabs it]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [reading from paper] Can you make that straighter? That job looks hard. You should put your mouth on that. How can you even use that one naturally?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Blowing up balloons I thought.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You might want to trim it a little.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Michael... [Kelly enters conference room in a flirty red dress]

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: [reading sign] Oh, is... Ryan coming back today?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, he is.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pam and Jim are together. Ryan is visiting. Only thing that could make this day better is ice cream.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: What do you want?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: To give you this [reveals a cat from under a coat].

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Oh, what is that?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It's a feral barn cat. I trapped him last night and I'm giving him to you as a replacement cat for the one I destroyed.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Her name was Sprinkles.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: And his name is... Garbage. Mose calls him Garbage because he likes to eat garbage. [shakes cat] Don't you Garbage? [makes chomping noises]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I can't believe you just thought you could replace Sprinkles. Before she's even in the ground.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You haven't buried her yet?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Don't rush me. I'm grieving.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Garbage can be very helpful. OK, he's a youthful cat. He killed an entire family of raccoons. [holds cat towards Angela] Look at him.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I don't want Garbage! I want Sprinkles! [walks away]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey Toby.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Hey... [sees both Jim and Pam] you two.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey. So now that we are dating, uh, we just wanted to know if we had to sign one of those 'we're dating' things for the company.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Oh well, you know, those were only for, you know [makes quotes with fingers] relationships, so... if, if this is just a casual thing, there's no need, really.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well, I don't wanna speak for Jim, but, it's like pretty official. [Jim smiles]

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Uh huh.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Sorry, uh do we need to sign one, or...?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Let's just wait and see what happens. [whispers] You know?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Let's just wait.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, OK.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: OK.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Great. [Jim and Pam walk away]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [sees Ryan coming through door] Hey Ryan. Welcome back --

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Hold on one second. [Ryan types on Blackberry for a few seconds] Hey Pam! It's great to see you. Is Michael in?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: There he is! There he is! He's back! And he's with a beard. [laughing] He... He has facial hair. Look at him! All grown up and no place to go. Hello, Mr. Sunny Crockett. I'm Tubs.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: OK. Should we get started?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ohh, yeah, let's get started because uh, yes, cause uh this is very serious business and umm..

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yep, exactly. This is a business meeting.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: ...business meeting --

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [rubbing hands in Ryan's hair] Fire!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Stop that! Stop that!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That's right! That's right!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: [to Kevin] You scared me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Fire guy. Don't start any fires, Ryan.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Fire guy [makes flames with his hands]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: You weren't here for that.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Here for what?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: When he started the fire.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Look how big he is. Look at you, you are so mature and old and little man now. You're like our little man...

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Little old man boy.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Michael and everybody, umm...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Beard.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Bearded man boy.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: ...let me just say something. I know I used to be a temp here, but now everything is different. I'd like your respect. I am your boss now. You're gonna have to treat me that same way you treated Jan.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, wow!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: So...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That's a little kinky. I don't swing that way.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: OK...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Woooo![laughs] I think Ryan has a gay crush on me.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Enough! OK? This is inappropriate  and it stops right now. Do you understand?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, everybody, come on. Settle town. Let's get serious here. Um Ryan, has a very special, important presentation to do, which we will be doing in the conference room in [looks at Ryan] 10 minutes?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Perfect.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Sounds good. OK, alright.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, Ryan snapped at me, but there was this twinkle in his eye that I picked up on, which said, "Dude, we're friends. I'm doing this for appearances. I am the big boss now. And I have to seem like an ogre. But you know me and you trust me. And we like each other. And we'll always be friends. And I would never take you for granted in a million years. And I miss you, man. And I love you." His words.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Dunder Mifflin Infinity represents a floor to ceiling streamlining of our business model. The center piece of the campaign is a new business-to-business website interface that will allow us to compete directly with big box chains.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wait a second. Last time I checked, Dunder Mifflin already has a website. And quite frankly, I'm not really sure what's wrong with it. [Jim at his desk, showing the Dunder Mifflin website reading "Under Construction. Coming Christmas 2002!"]

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: This is a massive overhaul. We're getting younger. Sleeker. And more agile so that we adapt to the market place. All essential personnel will be issued Blackberries for company use.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OOhh. Gimmme, gimme, gimme, gimme, gimme, gimme.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I'll stick around to help you set them up afterwards. Any questions? Dwight?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What if we don't want to use a Blackberry because they are stupid and pointless?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: This is company-wide, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Got it. [Andy's hand goes up]

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Andy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: We should call it Dunder Mifflinfinity. You know, push the words together?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Any other questions? [Kelly's hand goes up] Kelly Kapoor.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Can we speak privately about our relationship?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Thank you everybody.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ryan Howard everybody. [starts clapping] Good job. [everyone gets up to leave]

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: That's some fun stuff. When does the website go up?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: As fast as possible. We want to start retraining people A.S.A.P., so we can hit the ground running with a new system.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Cool beans.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: We're screwed.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Who is?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Us? You and me. The old timers.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I am not old. You are old. You are like a hundred.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: You're over 40, that's the cut off. Are you listening to what he's saying? Re-training. New system. Youth. I'm telling you this kid is the grim reaper. You deal with this or you, me, Sammy, Phyllis, the chick you hit with the car, we're goners.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Swore I wouldn't tell anyone this, but in the interest of revealing secrets. Oh my God, this will make your brain explode. Umm, Dwight and Angela dating. Have been for six months.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No.. [in awe]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Swear to God. [Pam shakes her head]. Aww this is great. I was actually gonna wait and tell you on your birthday, but this is much more fun.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, they have been dating for like two years. [Jim in shock] Since before your barbeque.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wait. What? [Pam nods her head] You knew? And you didn't say anything?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You didn't say anything to me?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Fair enough. Wow! We should have started dating like a long time ago.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Can you believe that...

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Sorry, I didn't know you guys were in here.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh no, we're just sitting here.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I couldn't see your hands. [Jim shakes his hands] Hey Pam, by the way, it's great that you're dating. But when a new client calls, you just have to randomly assign them to a sales person. You can't base who gets new clients on who you're sleeping with that week, OK?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: OK.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: OK.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: OK.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: And... that is why we waited so long to tell people.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: OK, what's up?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, kay. I was just... After the presentation, just wanted to make sure, that vis-a-vie, that everything in the office is business as usual?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Well it is business, but not as usual.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, I know I understand... we're making great strides and we're updating, but business as usual, no?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: No. [shaking head] We're throwing out the entire playbook, we're starting from scratch, we're implementing a brand new system.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good, so, we're on the same page?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: No. We're not. Michael, I know exactly how much time and man power are wasted in this branch. This company is getting younger, faster, more efficient. You need to prepare yourself.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We had a foreign exchange student live with us when I was young. And we called him my brother. And that's who I thought he was. Um, then he went home to what is now formerly Yugoslavia, taking all of my blue jeans with him. And I had to spend the entire winter in shorts. That is what Ryan is like. A fake brother who steals your jeans.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: So, how are you?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Awesome. I am dating a lot of guys.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Good.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: A lot. Black guys mostly.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Kelly...

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: What?!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Wait, uh, how do you touch just one of these buttons at a time?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I don't know.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Did you even try?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: If the kid wants to set mine up, I'll let him.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I can't see half of the things. [adjusts glasses]

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: It's too little. Use the phone.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I want you to tell me that you care about me. That is what I want.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Kelly, I'm your boss now, OK? You can't keep talking to me like I'm your boyfriend.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Oh big strong man, fancy new whatever. I don't think you ever cared about me.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I never cared about you? Six months ago Karen Filipelli sent me an email. Asked me out. I said no, because I was committed to our relationship.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Well, I hope you're still committed because I'm pregnant.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: [shaking head]

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: And guess what buddy, [points at Ryan] I am keeping it.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: OK. OK.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Do you feel prepared to help me raise a baby?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I can... I can't talk about this right now, OK? After work, we'll go out to dinner, we'll talk about it then, OK?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: We have a date!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hello.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Hello, Dwight. I've been thinking about things and I wanted to know if you would have dinner with me tonight?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'll make a reservation. No, no. Let me cook for you. Cauliflower and noodles. Baked potato on the side.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I would prefer a public place. See you after work.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Hi, Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Is Michael in?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: In his office. You can go right in.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: [to Ryan] Hey.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Jan.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Ryan. Ryan. Ryan, Ryan.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: So elephant in the room, I have your old job.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Well, not exactly my job... I had a different title.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Oh well, excuse me, same office, same responsibilities.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Different salary. [laughs] You'll get there, don't worry.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Well... you look great.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Thank you, thank you.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Scranton suits you.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Best decision I ever made.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: You were let go.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: You know what? I love the beard. Keep it forever. [goes into Michael's office]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [holds up Blackberry] Hey, what is the actual deal with these things in terms of testicles?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don't want to grow weird sperm in case we ever want to have kids.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: So, what's Ryan doing here?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, I dunno, they're launching a big new business plan. New website, blah blah blah. He's being a real twerp about it, so, it's all about youth, and agility and streamlining and trying to squeeze out the older people.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: He's such a snake.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well...

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: I hope he's gets hit with an ageism suit.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What is that... word?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Ageism? Companies they can't discriminate against people due to old age. Like a couple years ago we tried to force out some of the older branch managers with a mandatory retirement age and then Ed Truck, your old boss, threatened us with a lawsuit, so we had to back off.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So older people have just as many rights as younger people?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Yes, Michael, they do.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Creed?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Yes, sir.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Everything OK? [Creed has made his hair jet black]

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Everything's cool, dude.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: I'm thirty. Well, in November I'll be thirty.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Is there another meeting scheduled, I was gonna do the Blackberry tutorial in here.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael told us to wait in here. We don't know why.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: [notices pictures on the wall] Ohh... man.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good, we're all here, we can get started.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Have a seat.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: We're not doing this today.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Have a seat. Like everybody else.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: OK. This is...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Still my office, Ryan. [Ryan sits down] Well, there has been a lot of talk about new ideas today. Well, new ideas are fine, but they are also... illegal, because they are a form of ageism. What? Yes, I am right. Did you know that the Age Discrimination and Employment Act of 1967 prohibits employment discrimination based on age with respect to employees 40 years of age or older? I did.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Technically, he's right.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, shut up Toby. Look, why do we as a society hate old people so much?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Because they're lame.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, Creed, no they are not. In fact, many cultures revere old people because of their storytelling ability. Like the old lady from Titanic. [points to her picture on the wall] Or the funny things that they can do, like "where's the Beef?" [points to another picture on wall] [Jim raises his hand] Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Why do you have the Big picture up again? You used that already, when you burned your foot.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Reusing the Ben Kingsley, too.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I was going to put up some new pictures, but umm, all of the ink in the printer was gone.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh. [man enters conference room]

quotes.speaker: Robert Dunder
quotes.text: Michael Scott?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [puts hand up] That is me. Come on in. [They shake hands] Who is this old fart? Did you just stagger off the street? Out of a box or something? Who's this worthless bag of bones? Well, this guy is none other than one of the founders of Dunder Mifflin, Mr. Robert Dunder. Huh? [starts clapping, others join in]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, yeah. Yes!

quotes.speaker: Robert Dunder
quotes.text: Thank you everyone.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Michael, [gets up] can I talk to you a second?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Sure thing. [both go out of conference room] 'Scuse me. [closes door]

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: We have actual work to do.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Fine. Then I will call David Wallace and you can explain to him why you threw the founder of the company out on his ancient butt. [they glare at each other]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Bob, how old are you?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Eighty-seven years young. And still active. That is great. Did you know, that Bob is still a member of the Board of Dunder Mifflin?

quotes.speaker: Robert Dunder
quotes.text: Well, I, I, I haven't been to a board meeting in years. I, I send a proxy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ah, still sends his own proxy. Good for you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'm gonna live for a very long time. My grandma Schrute lived to be 101. My grandpa Manheim is 103, and still puttering around in Argentina. I tried to go visit him once, but my travel visa was protested by the Shoah Foundation.

quotes.speaker: Robert Dunder
quotes.text: I started this company in 1949.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wow.

quotes.speaker: Robert Dunder
quotes.text: Back then, it was an uh, an industrial supplier of metal brackets mostly for, for construction.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, boy.

quotes.speaker: Robert Dunder
quotes.text: And then Mifflin, of course he killed himself later... Uh, but I knew Mifflin through the Rotary Club.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Great.

quotes.speaker: Robert Dunder
quotes.text: And he was, he was [starts laughing] at dinner with Beverly and her husband, wha-what was his name, umm... uhh... Jerry.. Jerry Trupiano from, from South Jersey and he was tall. Both he and Mifflin were tall guys.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Great.

quotes.speaker: Robert Dunder
quotes.text: And...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That's great. Thank you for coming in. [starts ushering him out] Robert Dunder everybody. [clapping] Thank you. That was wonderful. Do you have a ride?

quotes.speaker: Robert Dunder
quotes.text: Well I, I, I came here in a cab.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Perfect. [starts closing the door]

quotes.speaker: Robert Dunder
quotes.text: Well, cou, could you get me another... [Michael closes door]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Inspirational. What have we learned?  Well, we have learned that you can't teach an old dog new tricks, because it's illegal, and you will go to jail. [Pam raises hand]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I think that I should help him get home.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, No. Don't help him. He doesn't need help, Pam. [Jim nods head and Pam gets up and leaves to help Robert Dunder, Michael shows Robert thumbs up] What a nice guy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good night guys. [staff leaves the office]

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Well, today was a fantastic waste of time.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I disagree, I think it was very valuable.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Michael, technology helps business OK? You should not resist it, this is the way the world is moving.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I happen to think the old ways of doing business are better. And I can prove it.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Ok. I look forward to hearing your ideas. [Michael retreats back to office] [to Kelly] Where do you wanna go?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: You know, some place romantic and expensive.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Kelly, come on.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: You know what, you're right. I'm feeling kind of nauseous anyway. So, you know skip it. [Ryan hesitates and takes her hand and they exit]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Are you enjoying your vegetarian noodles?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Very much. How's your meat?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Dry. Delicious.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I heard a joke today.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, that's funny.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Yes, it was.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Are you enjoying your mineral water?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I can't do this. I can't be with you. Every time I look in your eyes I see Sprinkles' stiff lifeless body.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Then don't look in my eyes. Look right here [points to middle of forehead above the eyes], it's an old sales trick.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I'm sorry. I gave this everything I could.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, please don't do this, monkey.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I will leave your toothbrush on top of your tire tomorrow morning. [gets up and leaves restaurant]

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Hey guys.  This is my, uh, girlfriend, Amy.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey, Amy.  How ya doing?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Nice to meet you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [under his breath] Nice to meet you.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: [gesturing to the rest of the office] This is everybody else... okay... This is the place... so thanks for the lift.

quotes.speaker: Amy
quotes.text: Yeah, sure. I'll, uh, I'll see you tonight, right?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Absolutely. [Toby kisses Amy for an extended period of time, Pam and Jim are shocked]

quotes.speaker: Amy
quotes.text: Whoa.  Easy tiger.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I just really like you.

quotes.speaker: Amy
quotes.text: Okay.  Bye guys.  Nice to meet you.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Have a great day!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Whoa, Toby.  Watch out.  You're going to violate your own PDA memo.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I wouldn't want to do that now would I?
